== Main Inclusion Report for paste ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/p/paste]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architectures or some subset ?
# ''Rationale:''
** Build dependency of python-pastedeploy.
0. ''Security:''
** No <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=python-paste|CVE entries]]</nowiki>.
** No <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=python-paste|Secunia history]]</nowiki>.
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid or any daemons.
** No network activity.
** It  directly (not through a library) structured (PDF, etc) data.
** No source code review performed.
0. ''Quality assurance:''
** The package should always work out of the box without configuration
** No debconf questions asked.
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:paste|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>
** <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/p/paste.html|Maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki> is calm.
** <nowiki>[[http://pythonpaste.org/|Upstream]]</nowiki> is vigorous.
** <nowiki>[[http://trac.pythonpaste.org/pythonpaste/report|Upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki>
** No special hardware is needed.
** There is an upstream testsuite but it is not enabled in the debian package.
0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliant.
** Uses debhelper with no patch system.
0. ''Dependencies:''
** debhelper, dpatch, python-all, python-support, python-setuptools, python-sphinx, python-pkg-resources, 
0. ''Maintenance:''
** paste is a realitively simple package that will be taken care of the Ubuntu Package.
